fabric_conditioner.name: Fabric Conditioner Kit
fabric_conditioner.description: Complete kit to prepare premium fabric conditioner similar to Comfort brand with excellent fragrance

steps.title: Initial Mix
steps.instruction: Pour 10 liters of RO water in the large bucket. Add 'Fabric Softener' from kit and mix well using plastic stick
steps.tip: Mix thoroughly to ensure even distribution

steps.title: Resting Period
steps.instruction: Leave mixture for 6 hours. Mix once every 1 hour during this period
steps.tip: This allows the mixture to properly hydrate and form paste consistency

steps.title: Dilution
steps.instruction: After 6 hours, mixture will turn into paste. Pour remaining 10 liters of RO water and mix until well dissolved
steps.tip: Add water gradually while stirring for smooth consistency

steps.title: Color Preparation
steps.instruction: Mix the color powder with 1/4 liter (250ml) of RO water separately
steps.tip: Dissolve completely to avoid color streaks

steps.title: Fragrance Addition
steps.instruction: Pour SCENT into the main mixture and mix well
steps.tip: This gives the signature pleasant fragrance

steps.title: Final Coloring
steps.instruction: Slowly add the color powder mixture little by little while stirring, adjust to desired color intensity
steps.tip: Add gradually to achieve perfect color without overdoing

recipe.final_result: 20 liters of premium fabric conditioner similar to Comfort brand with excellent fragrance and softening properties

usage_instructions.application: Add 1 cap (30ml) per load of laundry during rinse cycle
usage_instructions.storage: Store in cool, dry place. Use within 6 months of preparation

troubleshooting.too_thick: Add small amount of RO water and mix
troubleshooting.weak_fragrance: Ensure proper mixing of scent, may add slight extra if needed
troubleshooting.color_uneven: Mix more thoroughly, strain if necessary
troubleshooting.not_softening: Check if fabric softener was mixed properly in step 1

faq.question: How much water do I need?
faq.answer: You need exactly 20 liters of RO (purified) water - 10L for initial mix, 10L for dilution, and 250ml for color mixing

faq.question: Can I use tap water instead of RO water?
faq.answer: RO water is recommended for best results. Tap water may affect quality due to minerals and chlorine

faq.question: How long does the prepared conditioner last?
faq.answer: When stored properly, it lasts 6 months. Keep in cool, dry place away from direct sunlight

faq.question: What colors are available?
faq.answer: Color powder in kit can produce various shades - typically blue, pink, or green. Mix gradually to achieve desired intensity

faq.question: Is it safe for baby clothes?
faq.answer: Yes, once properly prepared and diluted, it's safe for all fabrics including baby clothes
